conclusion: Analyze optical reflection problem using geometric optics.
Right triangular prism with angles A = 90°, B = 60°, light path D → E → F, D is midpoint of CG, EG perpendicular to AC, intersects BC at G.
Find angle of deviation between incident ray at D and final exit ray.
Identify reflection angles: i₁, r₁ at D; i₂, r₂ at E; i₃, r₃ at F.
By law of reflection, i = r, so i₁ = r₁, i₂ = r₂, i₃ = r₃.
Angle C = 30° since angles in triangle sum to 180°.
Triangle CEG has right angle at E, angle GCE = 30°.
Angle CDG = 90° since D is midpoint of CG, light ray enters perpendicularly to BC.
Ray DE makes angle of 30° with AC, i₂ = r₂ = 30° by law of reflection.
Angle of incidence at F is i₃ = 60° due to total internal reflection, r₃ = i₃ = 60°.
Final ray after F makes angle of 30° with horizontal, angle of deviation = 90° + 30° = 120°.
Angle of deviation of incident light relative to point D is 120°.
